;;游客在匈牙利国家博物馆的世界新闻摄影展上观看摄影记者 Hannah Reyes Morales 拍摄的《黄金同性恋者之家》
;

;尽管法律禁止向未成年人“宣扬同性恋”，但匈牙利政府仍允许 18 岁以下青少年参观以 LGBT 人群照片为主题的世界新闻摄影展，因此周一解雇了国家博物馆馆长。

;

;上个月，当极右翼 Mi Hazank（我们的祖国）政党就该问题发起政府调查时，围绕展览的紧张局势浮出水面。调查的核心照片，;黄金同性恋之家;由摄影记者汉娜·雷耶斯·莫拉莱斯 (Hannah Reyes Morales) 拍摄，追踪菲律宾马尼拉一家社区经营的 LGBT 人群老年护理院的居民。

;

;Mi Hazank 引用了 2021 年的一项法律，该法律禁止“展示和宣传同性恋”适合 18 岁以下青少年阅读的书籍和电影。

;
;

;;相关：;;匈牙利反 LGBT 法禁止 18 岁以下青少年参加世界新闻摄影展;

; ;

;总理维克托·欧尔班 (Viktor Orbán) 政府称该法律旨在保护儿童，但该法律受到了欧盟和人权组织的抨击。

;

;在政府调查后，博物馆表示，它已经无权要求参观者出示身份证件以确定年龄，但其网站上包含一条信息，呼吁 18 岁以下青少年不要参观展览。

;

;文化和创新部长周一表示，拉斯洛·西蒙 (Laszlo Simon)，博物馆馆长因未能遵守“机构的法律义务”而被解雇。

;

;西蒙在 Facebook 帖子中承认自己被解雇，但否认博物馆故意违反任何法律。他表示，该研究所已“立即”在其网站上标记了年龄限制。

;

;文化部和政府发言人没有立即回复路透社通过电子邮件发送的问题。

;

;西蒙– 欧尔班保守派青年民主联盟 (Fidesz party) 的前议员 – 在早些时候的 Facebook 帖子中感谢米·哈桑克 (Mi Hasank) 对展览的宣传，因为周末博物馆外排起了长队。

;

;今年，一些;匈牙利书商因销售描绘同性恋的书籍而被罚款;，未按照立法要求用塑料包裹。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 08:52:01 +0800 John Oliver backs ‘weird, puking’ pūteketeke as he takes New Zealand’s bird of century poll globalhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/john-oliver-backs-weird-puking-puteketeke-as-he-takes-new-zealands-bird-of-century-poll-global
;;2023-11-07T00:39:58Z;
;
;;约翰·奥利弗
;

;英国喜剧演员、美国脱口秀主持人约翰·奥利弗爆炸成新西兰的鸟儿世纪竞赛，开展全球运动，支持受到威胁的普特科特克。

;

;;每年为期两周的竞赛;通常会吸引总共约 60,000 张选票。自从奥利弗在美国周日播出的《上周今夜秀》中宣布自己为普特科特克的官方竞选经理以来，到目前为止，一夜之间就获得了同样数量的选票。

;

;“这就是民主的意义所在。 – 美国干涉外国选举，”他说。

;
;

;;相关：;;新西兰将在本世纪鸟类民意调查中添加灭绝物种以突出野生动物威胁;

;
;

;在节目中，;Oliver; 在世界各地的多个地点推出了广告牌，其中包括在英国的移动卡车广告牌，挑战英国人“帮助我们加冕真正的国王”，如 pūteketeke 和不是查尔斯国王。

;

;“它们是奇怪的呕吐鸟，身上有五颜六色的鲻鱼。有什么理由不爱这里呢？”奥利弗说，普特克特克会吃掉数百根羽毛来填饱肚子，然后再把它们吐出来。

; ;

;奥利弗赞扬了这只鸟的平等共同养育方式，即雄性和雌性轮流孵蛋。普特科特克鸟不同寻常的交配仪式也让奥利弗产生了共鸣，两只鸟“抓住一丛湿草，互相碰撞胸部，然后站在那里不确定下一步该做什么，”他说。

;

;奥利弗承认该节目的该活动“极其激进”，买下了新西兰、日本、法国、英国、印度和美国威斯康星州的广告牌。一架带有 pūteketeke 竞选横幅的飞机飞过巴西里约热内卢的海滩。

;

;“我不只是希望 pūteketeke 获胜。我希望它能在这场比赛历史上最大的压倒性胜利中获胜，”他一边穿过工作室，一边走到一个比他高两倍的巨大鸟木偶面前说道。

; ;

;该比赛此前曾经历过争议，包括;2021 年是蝙蝠，而不是鸟类。;

;

;每年，通常是当地的志愿者都会为选定的 75 种鸟类候选者开展竞选活动此次比赛由保护组织 Forest & 主办。鸟。奥利弗面对的是奥克兰一所小学，该小学正在为有声乐天赋的图伊进行竞选活动，而奥塔哥大学的研究生则代表跳岩企鹅。

;

;“不，我们并不介意。美国重量级人物上周今晚突然加入竞选活动。我们是咸的（而且富含磷虾），因为我们是海鸟。”奥利弗​​表演后，企鹅官方活动 ;Instagram 帐户上这样写道.;

;

;微小的黄色 pīwauwau 岩鹪鹩 ;以约 2,800 票赢得 2022 年年度鸟类比赛;。截至上周五，当 Forest &据世纪之鸟发言人埃伦·赖克斯 (Ellen Rykers) 介绍，伯德最后一次统计结果时，啄羊鹦鹉（一种绿色高山鹦鹉）处于领先地位。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 08:52:01 +0800 China ‘world’s biggest debt collector’ as poorer nations struggle with its loanshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/06/china-worlds-biggest-debt-collector-as-poorer-nations-struggle-with-its-loans
;;2023-11-06T23:00:50Z;
;
;;Kimuka 火车线路
;

;中国已成为世界上最大的收债国，因为它的钱一份新报告显示，发展中国家欠债已飙升至 1.1 万亿美元（8,890 亿英镑）至 1.5 万亿美元。据估计，中国在南半球的海外贷款组合中有 80% 目前正在支持陷入财务困境的国家。

;

;自 2017 年以来，中国一直是全球的;最大;双边贷款机构；其主要开发银行在 2008 年至 2021 年间发行了近 5000 亿美元。虽然其中一些早于 ;一带一路倡议;（BRI）是北京的旗舰发展计划，已调动了发展中国家的大量投资。

;

;但一份新报告由 William & 的 AidData 研究实验室的研究人员设计弗吉尼亚州一所公立大学玛丽发现，世界第二大经济体中国目前正在扮演国际收债人的角色，并成为重大基础设施项目的双边资助者。

;

;来自中国政府的贷款受支持的银行帮助肯尼亚建设铁路、柬埔寨发电厂以及数千个其他项目。 AidData 研究人员分析了 165 个低收入和中等收入国家的 20,985 个项目，这些项目在 2000 年至 2021 年间通过价值 1.34 万亿美元的赠款和贷款融资。

;

;研究人员发现，随着中国贷款机构的债务不断增加暂停或取消的项目数量也有所增加。由于大量贷款流向陷入财务困境或面临财务困境风险的国家，北京现在越来越担心违约风险。

;

;6 月，赞比亚达成一项历史性协议，重组 63 亿美元的国家债务，其中三分之二欠中国两大政策性银行之一的中国进出口银行。

;

;为了降低未来违约风险，中国政策制定者采取了一系列措施，包括减少基础设施项目贷款，同时增加;紧急贷款;。 2015年，基础设施项目贷款占中国贷款总额的60%以上。到 2021 年，这一比例略高于 30%，其中紧急贷款占比近 60%。

;

;“中国的表现越来越像国际危机管理者，”研究人员总结道。中国为陷入金融困境的国家创建了“安全网”——“进而为那些面临高度风险的中国债权人”。

;
;

;;相关：;;中国在一带一路上花费了2400亿美元研究发现，从 2008 年到 2021 年的救助计划;

;
;

;中国银行试图降低风险敞口的另一种方法是提高逾期还款的处罚力度，此举可能会疏远借款人。 AidData报告援引盖洛普世界民意调查的数据显示，低收入和中等收入国家对中国的公众支持率从2019年的56%下降到2021年的40%。

;

;具体的中国贷款往往不透明，但经济学家 ;据估计，中国政府向低收入国家提供的贷款利率通常为 2%，而世界银行优惠贷款的利率标准为 1.54%。但AidData研究人员发现，在“一带一路”倡议初期（2014-2017年）和后期（2018-2021年）期间，中国贷方将逾期还款的最高罚金利率从3%提高到8.7%。

;该报告的作者之一、AidData 执行董事布拉德利·帕克斯 (Bradley Parks) 表示：“在许多最大的借款人缺乏流动性或无力偿债的情况下，北京正在努力寻找自己作为全球最大官方收债机构的地位。而且收债人并没有赢得很多人气竞赛。”

;

;不过，帕克斯指出，“中国不会袖手旁观，眼睁睁地看着其旗舰全球基础设施计划崩溃和烧毁。”帕克斯表示，北京目前正在执行一项“救援任务”，以最大程度地减少债务困扰，但政府也在“打持久战”。 “它正在制定一套贷款偿还保障措施......旨在确保一带一路倡议面向未来。”

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 07:22:01 +0800 Assistant to Ukrainian military commander killed by booby-trapped gifthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/06/aide-ukrainian-military-commander-killed-booby-trapped-gift
;;2023-11-06T22:24:25Z;
;
;;根纳季·查斯蒂亚科夫
;

;乌克兰军队总司令的亲密顾问已被任命为他收到的一份生日礼物发生爆炸后被杀。

;

;“在悲惨的情况下，我的助手兼亲密朋友根纳迪·查斯蒂亚科夫少校在他的生日那天被杀了，”瓦列里·扎卢日尼将军在 Telegram 上发帖称。周一，他说“一个未知爆炸装置在他的一件礼物中引爆”。

;

;查斯蒂亚科夫留下了妻子和四个孩子，他说。扎卢日内补充说，自俄罗斯于 2022 年 2 月入侵乌克兰以来，查斯蒂亚科夫一直“将自己的一生完全奉献给乌克兰武装部队和对抗俄罗斯侵略”。

;

;自莫斯科以来，针对乌克兰领导人的袭击相对较少但俄罗斯民族主义者也遭受了数起袭击，俄罗斯将其归咎于乌克兰。四月份，来自 ;一座装有炸药的小雕像杀死了 40 岁的亲克里姆林宫军事博主弗拉德伦·塔塔斯基;。

;

;克里姆林宫表示，这次袭击是乌克兰在乌克兰支持者的帮助下精心策划的。监禁了克里姆林宫批评者阿列克谢·纳瓦尔尼 (Alexei Navalny)，但观察人士表示，这起爆炸事件可能是为了证明进一步镇压批评者而设计的。

;

;去年 8 月，著名极端民族主义知识分子的女儿达里娅·杜吉纳 (Darya Dugina) 在一场汽车爆炸中丧生莫斯科郊外，俄罗斯也将其归咎于乌克兰。

;

;同样在周一，乌克兰军队表示，他们在所吞并的克里米亚刻赤造船厂成功摧毁了一艘俄罗斯船只，乌克兰总统弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基表示，他没有这样做在关于 2024 年总统投票可能性的激烈辩论中，相信该国举行选举的时机已经成熟。

;

;根据自去年战争开始以来一直实行的戒严令。

;

;“我们必须决定，现在是保卫的时刻，是战斗的时刻，关系到国家和人民的命运，”泽连斯基在每日讲话中说道。他表示，现在是国家团结的时候，而不是分裂的时候，并补充道：“我认为现在不是选举的时候。”

;

;乌克兰外交部长上周表示，泽连斯基正在权衡利弊。鉴于入侵，明年是否有可能举行选举。他警告说，由于 ;Bored Ape 数字艺术;

;Bored Ape 加密艺术热潮背后的公司正在调查报告人们在参加其中一场由紫外线灯照明的活动后，出现了眼睛灼伤、极度疼痛和视力受损的症状。

;

;ApeFest 节每年都会为 Bored Ape 游艇俱乐部的成员举办，又名 Bored Apes，投资了一系列 10,000 个不可替代代币 (NFT)，其中包含计算机生成的卡通猿头像。

;

;十多人参加了上周末在香港举行的 ApeFest随后在社交媒体上抱怨他们患有眼痛和视力问题。

;

;一位与会者在 X（以前称为 Twitter）上用 CryptoJune 发帖写道：“半夜醒来在 Apefest 之后，我的眼睛非常疼痛，不得不去医院……医生告诉我这是由于舞台灯光的紫外线造成的。我经常去参加节日，但从未经历过这种情况。”

;
;

;;相关：;;The Bored Ape NFT 热潮完全是关于自我和金钱，而不是艺术;

;
;

;与会者 Chloe Ge 告诉英国《金融时报》称，舞台灯光“相当强”，派对结束后凌晨 3 点左右，她开始感觉自己的眼睛“被辣椒灼伤”。

;

;她仍在经历一些不适据报纸报道，尽管疼痛现已缓解，但他感到不适。

;

;Adrian Zduńczyk 描述说，他醒来时发现“眼睛严重烧伤”，并前往医院，在那里他被诊断为患有;光角膜炎< /a>;（雪盲）双眼。这种情况是由于角膜和结膜不受保护地暴露在紫外线辐射下造成的。

;

;他被开了类固醇滴眼液和眼部润滑剂，并表示他的视力测试“接近完美”，没有严重的角膜损伤，“幸运的是”。

;

;Bored Ape Yacht Club 在 X 上发帖写道：“Apes，我们意识到与眼睛相关的问题影响了 ApeFest 的一些参加者，自此以来我们一直在积极主动地与个人联系昨天试图找到潜在的根本原因。

;

;“根据我们的估计，我们认为参加和工作的活动人员中只有不到 1% 出现这些症状。虽然几乎每个人都表示自己的症状有所改善，但我们鼓励任何有症状的人寻求医疗救助，以防万一。”

;

;据信约有 2,250 人参加了此次活动。 X 上发布的视频显示;一群人在紫外线灯下跳舞;。

;

;Bored Ape NFT，一种用于证明数字文件的所有权和真实性的加密资产形式，在许多;名人投资于他们;。然而，最近的一份报告发现，;绝大多数 NFT 现在已经一文不值;，自上市以来销量已暴跌 98% 2022 年 5 月达到顶峰。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 06:22:02 +0800 Unopened 18th-century love letters to French sailors read for first timehttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/nov/06/unopened-18th-century-love-letters-to-french-sailors-read-for-first-time
;;2023-11-06T19:01:45Z;
;
;;用丝带绑着的一捆信件。
;

;寄给法国水手的一捆被遗忘的情书260 多年前，在英国海军档案中发现了这封信，但此前从未被打开或阅读过，揭示了 18 世纪婚姻和家庭生活的私密细节。

;

;发现了 100 多封信件的非凡藏品。剑桥大学欧洲历史教授雷诺·莫里厄 (Renaud Morieux) 偶然在邱园国家档案馆询问档案管理员是否可以打开这些档案，以便他能够第一次阅读。

;

;在里面，他发现了针对水手们的深刻个人且往往充满激情的信息，他们于 1758 年在一艘法国军舰上被俘获，期间经历了七年的战争' 战争;。

;

;“我迫不及待地想拥有你”，一位海军妻子 Anne Le Cerf 在给她丈夫 Jean Topsent 的信中写道，这句话可以翻译为“拥抱”或“拥抱”。 “和你做爱”。她在纸条上签下了“你听话的妻子纳内特”，这是一个深情的绰号。托普森特是一名士官，被关押在英国，永远不会收到这封信。

;

;另一位通讯员玛丽·杜博斯克 (Marie Dubosc) 写信给她的丈夫、被俘战舰的中尉路易斯·尚布雷兰 (Louis Chambrelan)：“我可以花费写信给你的那个晚上……我是你永远忠实的妻子。晚安我亲爱的朋友。现在是午夜。我想我是时候休息了。”这对夫妇再也没有见面，因为第二年她在勒阿弗尔去世，几乎可以肯定是在他被释放之前。

;

;这些信是写给加拉泰号船员的，当时该船正从波尔多航行到魁北克。它被一艘英国船只扣押并带到朴茨茅斯，他们在那里被监禁。

;

;法国邮政管理局几个月来一直试图将船员亲人的信件寄给船上，并将副本发送到英国的港口。法国——正如当时的常见做法——希望在这艘船启航之前抓住它。当英国听说加拉蒂号被俘后，将这些信件转发给伦敦海军部，希望它们能够转交给囚犯。

;

;相反，在确定信件不包含任何军事价值后，英国人当局将这些未打开的信件存放起来，它们将被遗忘几个世纪，直到莫里厄偶然发现。

;

;“我只是出于好奇才订购了这个盒子，”莫里厄说。 “三堆信件用丝带绑在一起。这些信件非常小，而且是密封的，所以我问档案保管员是否可以打开它们，他打开了。

;

;“我意识到，自这些非常私人的信息写成以来，我是第一个阅读这些信息的人。他们的预期接收者没有得到这个机会。非常情绪化。”

; ;

;除了恋人之间的情侣关系外，该档案还提供了有关战争时期有时紧张的家庭关系的罕见见解。一位年轻水手尼古拉斯·奎内尔的母亲写信给他，抱怨他写给未婚夫的次数比写给她的还要多。 “向瓦林（船友）致意，”她写道。 “只有他的妻子才能告诉我你的消息。”

;

;包裹中还包含一封来自康内尔未婚夫玛丽安的信，要求他给他的母亲写封信，不要让她陷入尴尬的境地。她后来写道：“乌云已经散去，你母亲收到的一封信让你的心情变得轻松起来。”

;

;莫里厄对水手们进行了家谱研究，发现康内尔在入狱后幸存下来，后来1760 年代，加入了一艘跨大西洋奴隶船的船员。

;

;莫里厄表示，其中 59% 的信件是由女性写的，她们“打破了战争只涉及男性的老式观念。当她们的男人离开时，妇女负责管理家庭经济并做出重要的经济和政治决策”。

;

;他补充道：“这些信件讲述了人类的普遍经历，它们并不是法国或 18 世纪所独有的。 。它们揭示了我们如何应对重大的生活挑战。”

;

;他的研究结果发表在《年鉴》杂志上。历史，社会科学。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Tusk forced to wait as PiS given first chance to form Polish governmenthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/06/tusk-forced-to-wait-as-pis-given-first-chance-to-form-polish-government
;;2023-11-06T20:07:08Z;
;
;;唐纳德·图斯克
;

;唐纳德·图斯克，在上届比赛中宣布胜利;本月的波兰议会选举;，将不得不等待总统安杰伊·杜达 (Andrzej Duda) 表示，他将向执政的法律与正义党 (PiS) 提供第一次组建政府的机会。

;

;PiS，民族主义者，过去八年执政波兰的民粹主义政党在选举中赢得了所有政党中最多的选票，但远未达到议会多数席位。所有其他政党都排除了与他们结成联盟的可能性，这使得他们没有任何明显的途径来保留权力。

;

;反对派势力组成的广泛联盟，其中最大的联盟由前总理图斯克和欧洲理事会主席表示，他们已准备好并愿意组建政府。

;

;然而，根据宪法，总统可以选择谁第一个组建联合政府。 ;杜达长期与法律与公正党结盟，他慢慢来做出决定;，这被许多人视为浪费时间的策略。

;

;周一晚上，杜达在电视讲话中表示，他已与法律与公正党和图斯克公民联盟进行了磋商and both had claimed to be confident of forming a government.

;

;“Both – the representatives of Law and Justice, which obtained the best result in the elections, and the Civic Coalition, which took second place – presented their candidates for prime minister and expressed their will to form a government,” said Duda.

;

;“Therefore, I decided to continue the good parliamentary tradition, according to which the opportunity to form a government is given to the winning party.”

;

;Duda nominated the PiS prime minister, Mateusz Morawiecki, as his candidate. When the Sejm, the lower house of Poland's parliament, reconvenes next Monday, Morawiecki will have two weeks to attempt to form a working majority. PiS figures have claimed they still have a chance to build a coalition.

;

;“The chance that we will create a parliamentary majority is very low, but that does not mean it is zero,” the deputy foreign minister, Paweł Jabłoński, said on Monday.

;

;Assuming that Morawiecki fails to find a majority, after two weeks the Sejm will be able to nominate its own candidate. This is likely to be Tusk, who would then lead a broad grouping of opposition forces, including Civic Coalition, the centre-right Third Way and the leftist Lewica.

;

;Over the past weeks, Tusk and other leaders have been meeting to hash out a broad coalition agreement and distribute ministries and other key jobs.

;

;“The coalition is finalised in every detail and I hope that the president also hears it,” said Tusk on Monday, before Duda's announcement.

;

;Duda said if Morawiecki fails to put together a government and the parliament chooses its own prime ministerial candidate, he would respect the process.

;

;“If the mission of the representative of Law and Justice fails, then in the next step, the Sejm will choose a candidate for prime minister, and I will immediately appoint him to this position. All constitutional rules and deadlines will be respected,” he said.

;

;The election, on 15 October, followed a vicious and bitter campaign as PiS sought to win a third term in office. PiS mixed increased social spending with rightwing, populist rhetoric, attacking migrants and LGBT people and tightening Poland's already restrictive abortion laws.

;

;During the campaign, PiS's chair, Jarosław Kaczyński, called Tusk “the personification of evil” and suggested he was a traitor. Tusk, for his part, said the election was the last chance to save democracy in Poland, and promised legal retribution for those who committed abuses of office during the PiS years.

;

;Tusk has said his priorities in power would include de-politicising key state institutions that were taken over by PiS loyalists. However, he will be ;limited in his room for manoeuvre; by Duda, who will be in office until 2025 and has veto power over any legal initiatives, and by the breadth of his own coalition. Some of the more conservative elements of the coalition have already said they would not support legalising abortion up to 12 weeks, one of Tusk's campaign promises.

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Hispanic and Latino representation in film hasn’t improved for 16 years – studyhttps://www.theguardian.com/film/2023/nov/06/hispanic-latino-representation-movie-usc-study
;;2023-11-06T18:09:54Z;
;
;;Jennifer Lopez in Marry Me.
;

;Hispanics and Latinos remain underrepresented in film, a trend that has carried for 16 years, according to a new report from the University of Southern California. Even when movies did feature Hispanic or Latino characters, they were usually stereotyped as immigrant or as having low income.

;

;The latest ;study; from the Annenberg Inclusion Initiative examined 1,600 of the top-grossing films released between 2007 and 2022 and more than 62,000 speaking characters, as well as 13,000 directors, producers and casting directors.

;

;In the 16 years examined, only 75 (4.4%) actors in lead or co-lead roles were Hispanic or Latino; only five were Hispanic/Latina actors 45 years or older, and three of those roles were played by Jennifer Lopez. Less than 1% of all lead/co-lead roles since 2007 went to Afro-Latino actors, while 2.6% of all lead actors were US-born Latinos. There was not one year examined in which all film distributors released at least one movie with a Hispanic or Latino lead/co-lead.

;

;“There is a clear and persistent lack of stories that center on Hispanic/Latino actors and the Hispanic/Latino experience,” said Ariana Case, the study's lead author. “Despite the profusion of talent from this community, there is a clear reluctance on the part of the entertainment industry to develop and distribute these stories.”

;

;Of the seven biggest distributors, four had fewer than 10 films with a Hispanic of Latino lead during that timeframe. Warner Brothers had the worst record of the major studios, according to the study, with just three movies featuring a Hispanic/Latino lead or co-lead role in the 16-year span.

;

;The study also found that when Hispanic/Latino characters were represented on-screen, depictions were often rife with stereotypes. Nearly a quarter (24.4%) of Hispanic/Latino leads were depicted as immigrants, and the same percentage shown as low income. More than half (57.8%) were depicted as criminals, and nearly half (46.2%) as violent criminals. Forty per cent were portrayed as angry or temperamental, and 31.1% were sexualized.

;

;Afro-Latinos were particularly underrepresented. The study found that across the 100 top movies of 2022, just one protagonist – Nathalie Emmanuel in The Invitation – was portrayed by an Afro-Latina, and only eight Afro-Latino actors were cast in lead/co-lead roles between 2007 and 2016, representing less than 1% of all lead roles.

;

;The same held true for intersectionality for Hispanic/Latino characters. The study revealed that more than 95% of movies from between 2014 and 2022 were missing LGBTQ+ Hispanic/Latino characters, and only 1.8% of Hispanic/Latino characters in 2022 were shown with a disability.

;

;“Hispanic/Latinos are not a monolithic community, but film offers a very narrow picture that does little to communicate how diverse this group is,” said Case. “There is almost no representation of the array of communities that encompass this ethnic group. Few women, few LGBTQ+ Hispanic/Latinos and very few Hispanic/Latinos with disabilities are shown in film.”

;

;Hispanic and Latinos remain underrepresented behind the camera, as well. Across 16 years and 1,600 movies, less than 5% of directors were Hispanic or Latino, and only five of those 82 were women. The majority of Hispanic/Latino directors (69.5%) were born outside the US. And across the same time period, 3.1% of “produced by” credits went to Hispanic or Latinos; women represented 21.8% of those credits and less than 1% of producers overall.

;

;The study offered roadmaps for change, including expanded casting lists, searches and expectations; supporting grants for Hispanic/Latino creatives behind and in front of the camera; and creating tax incentives for productions hiring Hispanic/Latino individuals above the line.

;Hermoso said the kiss was not consensual and Rubiales, who also grabbed his crotch while celebrating ;Spain's 1-0 win against England;, was subsequently banned for three years by Fifa.

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 03:22:01 +0800 Wildcats and domestic cats began interbreeding in the 1960s, study suggestshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/06/wildcats-and-domestic-cats-began-interbreeding-in-the-1960s-study-suggests
;;2023-11-06T18:36:44Z;
;
;;Scottish captive-bred wildcat
;

;Humans weren't the only creatures to fall under the sway of free love in the 1960s. After 2,000 years of keeping one another at paw's length, wildcats and their domestic cousins began to interbreed about 60 years ago, a new study suggests.

;

;Doing so may have helped to protect their offspring against diseases harboured by domestic cats, but this interbreeding is now threatening the survival of wildcats as a distinct species.

;

;Domestic cats are generally considered to have descended from Near Eastern wildcats that prowled the Fertile Crescent of the Middle East back when early human farmers began storing grain. They arrived in Britain – where European wildcats also lived – about 2,200 years ago.

;

;Today, hybridisation between wild and domestic cats is pushing the Scottish wildcat population to the ;brink of extinction;, because the genes that define them are being “swamped” by those from hybrid and domestic cats.

;

;“Not only are we at risk of losing a species from Britain, we're potentially replacing it with hybrid and feral domestic cats that may be not as well adapted and may not perform the same ecological role in their habitat,” said ;Jo Howard-McCombe; of the University of Bristol and the Royal Zoological Society of Scotland (RZSS).

;

;“It is important to understand the history of this process, so that we can be better informed to manage that threat into the future.”

;

;To investigate when this interbreeding started, Howard-McCombe and her colleagues analysed genomic sequences from wild and domestic cats, including 48 modern felines and 258 ancient samples excavated from 85 archaeological sites over the last 8,500 years.

;

;The results, published in ;Current Biology;, suggested that these creatures broadly avoided sexual contact with one another until the late 1950s, when rates of interbreeding between wild and domestic cats in Scotland rose rapidly – possibly as a result of dwindling wildcat populations.

;

;“If you have a population of wildcats that's being completely eradicated, those that are left are going to want to mate with something, and if the only thing that's around are domestic cats, that's probably what they're going to choose,” said ;Prof Greger Larson; at the University of Oxford, who contributed to the research.

;

;In the short term, this may have benefited their offspring: domestic cats carry diseases that can also affect wildcats, and many of the genes that have accumulated in the hybrid cats relate to immune system function. “They may have helped to prevent the acquisition of those diseases, or at least make diseases not so bad,” Larson said.

;

;However, the longer-term consequence could be the loss of European wildcats from Scotland and other areas. Today, no wild-living or captive Scottish wildcat is thought to be entirely free of domestic cat ancestry, but the descendents of a captive breeding programme initiated by RZSS during the 1960s may be the closest thing to a pure breed.

;

;Nineteen of these wildcats were ;recently released; into a pine forest in the Scottish Highlands in the first phase of a project to rescue the species. Provided such captive-bred cats have a large enough area of wilderness to establish themselves in and breed, they should be spared the seductive lure of the domestic cat.

;

;However, to bolster their chances, Howard-McCombe advises local cat owners living nearby to get their pets neutered and vaccinated against common diseases.
